articles.title: 15th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
15th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held
						
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The 15th Kimjongilia Festival will be held on the occasion of leader Kim Jong Il's birthday.
					 It will open at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition in Pyongyang in mid-February Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 Entrants include armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, working people of different strata, school youth and children, overseas compatriots' organizations including the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and foreign friends.
					
					 Shows and visits to the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia hothouses are expected in provinces.

articles.title: State Price Bureau to Be State Price Commission
articles.content:
State Price Bureau to Be State Price Commission
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly to upgrade the State Price Bureau into the State Price Commission was promulgated on Thursday.

articles.title: Reception Given at DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Reception Given at DPRK Embassy
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Beijing hosted a reception on Jan. 11 on the occasion of the New Year.
					 Present there on invitation were Li Zhaoxing, chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and staff members of his embassy were present there.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.
					
					 The DPRK ambassador said that it is the consistent stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government to steadily consolidate and develop the traditional DPRK-China friendship. He reaffirmed the will of the DPRK to make every possible effort to boost the bilateral relations and defend peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and the region together with the Chinese comrades in the new year, too.
					
					 The chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the CNPC said that the Chinese party and government are attaching utmost importance to the Sino-DPRK relations. He stressed that China would strive to steadily develop the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations in the spirit of inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation together with the Korean comrades in the new year, too.

articles.title: Gift from Philippine Official
articles.content:
Gift from Philippine Official 
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Jose de Venecia, former speaker of the House of Representatives of Philippines. 
					 He handed over the gift to An Song Nam, DPRK ambassador to Philippines, on January 6.

articles.title: Agitation for Increased Production Brisk
articles.content:
Agitation for Increased Production Brisk
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Agitation for increased production is brisk in the DPRK to encourage the working people in their drive to implement the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial. It calls for bringing about a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living and the building of a thriving nation by accelerating the development of light industry once again this year. The agitation involves briefing on the main idea and contents of the editorial, explanation with the help of visual aids and arts performance and various other forms and methods.  
					 The agitation proves very successful at the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill, the Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory and other light industrial factories. 
					
					 The Ministry of Culture dispatched creative groups to light industrial factories and enterprises to help them produce works for performing programs. Meanwhile, arts squads are giving performances to mesmerize the workers. 
					
					 Artistes of the Phibada Opera Troupe, the State Theatrical Troupe and the State Folk Art Troupe staged their programs to encourage the workers alive with the drive to honor their assignments for the new year. 
					
					  Agitation for increased production was conducted by other groups. They included the Central Art Agitation Troupe, the Workers' Art Squad of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, the Art Squad of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, the Pyongyang City Art Squad and the Art Squad of the Ministry of Capital City Construction.
					
					 Successes of the similar arts agitation were reported from Kaesong, Sinuiju and Hoeryong and other cities and counties.

articles.title: DPRK's Best Wrestlers and Coaches for 2010
articles.content:
DPRK's Best Wrestlers and Coaches for 2010
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The DPRK selected best Korean wrestlers and coaches for 2010.
					 Wrestlers are Ri Hyok Chol of the North Phyongan Provincial Taekwon-do Team and Kwak Jong Min of the Pyongyang City Taekwon-do Team.
					
					 They won in the Korean wrestling games including the 13th national Taekwon-do championships for Jongilbong prize.
					
					 Coaches are Ri Si Hak of the North Phyongan provincial team and Ri Kyong Nam of the Pyongyang city team.

articles.title: Pyongyang Boasts Ancient Gate
articles.content:
Pyongyang Boasts Ancient Gate 
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- There are many historic relics dating back to Koguryo period in Mt. Taesong northeast of Pyongyang. 
					 Among them is the South Gate of Taesongsan Wall. It is believed to have been built before Koguryo shifted its capital to Pyongyang in 427. 
					
					 Restored to its former glory in September of 1978, the gate adds to the scenic beauty of Mt. Taesong and stirs up national sentiment. 
					
					 The 19.5 meter-high gate has a strong main base and supporting bases on its either side and the gatehouse built on the main base. 
					
					 Those bases were built with square granite. 
					
					 There is a gateway in the middle of the main base. 
					
					 Its frontispiece is five kans (17.15m) and its flank is two kans (6.3m). 
					
					 The gate is listed as a national heritage.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Global Independence
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Global Independence
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- It is the common task of humankind to achieve global independence. Only when anti-imperialist independent countries and nations struggle, aware of being responsible for the cause of global independence, can they display strong will power and practical ability and boost solidarity and unity among them.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The progressive countries aspiring after independence, socialism and justice are the main force in the struggle to achieve global independence.
					
					 All the anti-imperialist independent forces should unite as one in order to prevail over imperialism.
					
					 What is important for achieving their unity is for all the progressive forces, including the socialist movement, the non-aligned movement and the world peace movement to unite close under the banner of global independence. The communist and workers' parties advocating socialism and other revolutionary parties should firmly maintain their anti-imperialist stand and firmly unite on the basis of comradely relations of mutual respect and cooperation. 
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government have worked hard for global independence, regarding it as their noble task and international obligation to struggle for the cause.
					
					 The world socialist movement was saved from its temporary crisis and has since made dynamic progress under the banner of the Pyongyang declaration. The NAM has creditably performed its mission and role, augmenting its position as a strong independent force against imperialism in the present era. These would be unthinkable without positive activities and efforts of the WPK and the DPRK government.
					
					 They will as ever carry on the staunch struggle to achieve global independence, concludes the article.

articles.title: US Nuclear-Powered Carrier Flotilla Enters Ports of S. Korea
articles.content:
US Nuclear-Powered Carrier Flotilla Enters Ports of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- U.S. nuclear-power carrier Carl Vinson entered Pusan Port of south Korea on Jan. 11, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 A cruiser belonging to the nuclear-power carrier flotilla entered Pusan Port and two more cruisers Jinhae Port of South Kyongsang Province.
					
					 The Carl Vinson carrier flotilla reportedly belongs to the U.S. Seventh Fleet, replacing super nuclear-powered carrier George Washington.
					
					 Their entry into south Korea quite contrary to the desire of the Koreans to tide over the serious crisis prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and between the north and the south through dialogue and negotiations reveals the U.S. ulterior intention to escalate confrontation and ignite a war.

articles.title: South Korean Resident Put in Custody for Praising North
articles.content:
South Korean Resident Put in Custody for Praising North
						
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The Seoul District Public Prosecutors' Office detained and indicted an inhabitant for praising the north, according to MBC of south Korea on Jan. 10.
					 He was reported to have posted articles and animation files praising the Songun politics on internet, etc. The prosecution took the above-said action on charge of "spreading enemy-benefiting information".

articles.title: Early Opening of North-South Dialogue Called for
articles.content:
Early Opening of North-South Dialogue Called for 
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Organizations of overseas compatriots and personages in their statements are calling for an early start of the north-south dialogue.
					 The Overseas Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration noted in a statement on Jan. 8 that in order to wipe out misunderstanding and mistrust and improve the north-south relations both sides should meet to have candid dialogue and negotiations.
					
					  A spokesperson for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. said in a statement on Jan. 7 that the dialogue between the north and the south should be one bringing hope to the Korean nation, urging the south "government" to positively respond to the proposal of the DPRK.
					
					 The European Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration said in a statement on Jan. 8 that in order to achieve peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula it is necessary for fellow countrymen to sit at a negotiating table to open-heartedly clarify their stands and seek solutions to issues. 
					
					 Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, said in a statement on Jan. 6 that those who swim with the trend of national cooperation are patriots while those who go against it are traitors to the nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Supported
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of different countries made public statements in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					The Bangladesh People's League said in a statement on Jan. 8 that the joint New Year editorial is a militant banner as it reflects the noble idea and will of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the ways to materialize them.
					
					 The statement expressed belief that the Workers' Party of Korea would bring about uninterrupted innovations and advances, confident of victory, and thus effect a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living and the building of a great, prosperous and powerful nation and gain achievements in the struggle for national reunification.
					
					 The Federal Leadership of the Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation in a statement on Jan. 4 expressed its unequivocal support to the tasks laid down in the joint editorial.
					
					 Expressing hope that the dialogue between the north and the south of Korea would be realized in 2011 in the spirit of the north-south joint declaration, the organization noted it would make every effort to boost solidarity with the DPRK.
					
					 The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea said in a statement on Jan. 7 that it would organize diverse events to significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung with the Korean people.
					
					 The statement demanded the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop any military exercise likely to strain the situation on the Korean Peninsula in 2011.

articles.title: Important Proposal of DPRK Supported
articles.content:
Important Proposal of DPRK Supported
 Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The People's Socialist Party of Mexico, the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Mexican Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and six other political parties and organizations made public a joint statement on Jan. 6 in support of the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations. 
					 The statement expressed support and sympathy to the consistent stand of the DPRK to improve the north-south relations, promote the reconciliation and unity of the nation and open a landmark phase for peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people would hold high the historic banner of the north-south joint declarations and open a decisive phase for the peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula in the idea of "By our nation itself" without fail this year.
					
					 It strongly demanded the south Korean authorities, political parties and organizations to positively respond to the proposal of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations without delay and called on all the governments, political parties and  organizations, international organizations and progressive people of the world who love justice, truth and peace to extend unequivocal support to it.

articles.title: Se montara en Pyongyang el XV Festival de Kimjongilias
articles.content:
Se montara en Pyongyang el XV Festival de Kimjongilias
Pyongyang, 13 de enero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tendra lugar desde la segunda decena de febrero el XV Festival de Kimjongilias en la capitalina Exhibicion Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia.
					En el certamen participaran los organismos de las fuerzas armadas, ministerios, organos centrales, trabajadores de distintos sectores, jovenes y ninos escolares, entidades de coreanos en ultramar asi como amigos extranjeros.
					
					Tambien en todas las provincias se realizaran las exposiciones de dichas flores y la visita a los invernaderos de kimilsungias y kimjongilias.

articles.title: Embajada coreana en China ofrece banquete por el Ano Nuevo
articles.content:
Embajada coreana en China ofrece banquete por el Ano Nuev
Pyongyang, 13 de enero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Ano Nuevo, la Embajada de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en China ofrecio el dia 11 un banquete.
					  Fueron invitados Li Zhaoxing, presidente de la Comision de Asuntos Exteriores de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de China, Wu Donghe, presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad China-Corea, Hu Zhengyue, asistente del ministro de Relaciones Exteriores, y otros funcionarios. 
					
					  Estuvieron presentes el embajador Ji Jae Ryong y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica coreana.
					
					  En la ocasion hubo discursos.
					
					  Ji Jae Ryong dijo que el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el gobierno de la RPDC mantienen la invariable posicion de consolidar constantemente la tradicional amistad Corea-China y afirmo que en el Ano Nuevo tambien, se esforzaran en todo lo posible junto con los companeros chinos por fortalecer mas la amistad entre Corea y China y preservar la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region. 
					
					Li Zhaoxing ratifico que el partido y el gobierno de China aprecian mucho las relaciones entre los dos paises y expuso la decision de esforzarse en el Ano Nuevo tambien junto con los camaradas coreanos por desarrollar incesantemente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea conforme al espiritu de "continuacion de tradicion, aspiracion al futuro, buena vecindad y fortalecimiento de cooperacion".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de personalidad Filipina
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de personalidad Filipina
  Pyongyang, 13 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dirigiera el ex presidente de la Camara de Representantes de Filipinas, Jose de Venecia.
					  El ex presidente lo entrego el dia 6 al embajador coreano en su pais, An Song Nam.

articles.title: Apoyan en varios paises el editorial conjunto de Corea
articles.content:
Apoyan en varios paises el editorial conjunto de Corea
Pyongyang, 13 de enero (ATCC) -- Los partidos politicos y las entidades de varios paises publicaron sendas declaraciones para apoyar el editorial conjunto del Ano Nuevo de Corea.
					  La Liga Popular de Bangladesh indico en su declaracion fechada 8 que el editorial conjunto del Ano Nuevo es la bandera combativa que refleja el magno proposito y la voluntad del Dirigente       Kim Jong Il e indica los remedios para ponerlos en practica.
					
					  Expreso la conviccion de que con la fe en la victoria, el Partido del Trabajo de Corea innovara y avanzara constantemente para producir un cambio decisivo en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y la construccion de una gran potencia prospera y lograra exitos en la lucha por reunificar la patria.
					
					  En su declaracion publicada el dia 4, la Direccion Federal del Bloque Izquierdista de la Federacion de los Sindicatos de Austria apoyo totalmente las tareas combativas presentadas en el editorial conjunto.
					
					  Deseamos que se realice este ano el dialogo Norte-Sur de Corea conforme al espiritu de la Declaracion Conjunta N-S, indica la declaracion y expone la determinacion de esforzarse en todo lo posible por fortalecer la solidaridad con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					  El Comite de Jovenes Etiopes para el Estudio de la Idea Juche apunto en su nota publicada el dia 7 que organizaria varios actos para conmemorar significativamente con el pueblo coreano el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					  El documento insiste en que en 2011, Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas paren todos los ejercicios militares que agravan la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
